de.dfki.lt.loot
Class HighLight

java.lang.Object
  de.dfki.lt.loot.HighLight

public abstract class HighLight
extends java.lang.Object

HighLight Abstract class to highlight a JTextArea with the given search regex (post and pre) or the default one If you search more then one String, take care, may be part of the searched Strings already been colored.

Author:
chris

public static javax.swing.JTextArea areaHighLightWordFracture(javax.swing.JTextArea area,
                                                              java.lang.String[] toHighLight)
The area highlighter witch colored also in the words.
The REGEX in use is "".

Parameters:
area - the JTextArea that will be modified
toHighLight - the searched Strings
Returns:
JTextArea the modified aera

areaHighLight

public static javax.swing.JTextArea areaHighLight(javax.swing.JTextArea area,
                                                  java.lang.String[] toHighLight)
The default highlighter: Word sensitiv.
The pre and post REGEX in use is the DEFAULT_REGEX : "(($)|(^)|([^a-z[A-Z[0-9]]]))".

Parameters:
area - the JTextArea that will be modified
toHighLight - the searched Strings
Returns:
JTextArea the modified aera

areaHighLight

public static javax.swing.JTextArea areaHighLight(javax.swing.JTextArea area,
                                                  java.lang.String[] toHighLight,
                                                  java.lang.String prePostRegex)
A highlighter that gives you the possibility to pass your own REGEX ( the same for post and pre searched word)

Parameters:
area - the JTextArea that will be modified
toHighLight - the searched Strings
prePostRegex - The REGEX that will be added to the searched words at the end and the begining
Returns:
JTextArea the modified aera

areaHighLight

public static javax.swing.JTextArea areaHighLight(javax.swing.JTextArea area,
                                                  java.lang.String[] toHighLight,
                                                  java.lang.String preRegex,
                                                  java.lang.String postRegex)
A highlighter that gives you the possibility to pass your own REGEX.
One at the begining one at the end.

Parameters:
area - the JTextArea that will be modified
toHighLight - the searched Strings
preRegex - The REGEX that will be added to the searched words at the begining
postRegex - The REGEX that will be added to the searched words at the end
Returns:
JTextArea the modified aera

setColors

public void setColors(java.awt.Color[] colors)
Setter for the Color Table. The other function will use as much colors as possible. If there are not enough Colors in the table, the first one will be used for the rest of he words. The default Color is Color.RED.

Parameters:
colors - the color set you want to use

getColors

public java.awt.Color[] getColors()
Getter for the color set.

Returns:
Color[] the color set in use
